meanings.definition: Rolled or convoluted inward or upward.
meanings.sent1: The obvolute petals of the flower were tightly curled.
meanings.sent2: The obvolute pages of the book made it difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: The obvolute ribbon tied in a knot by itself!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were obvolute, swirling around in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The obvolute seashell was a beautiful spiral shape.

meanings.sent1: The obvolute layers of fabric created a thick barrier.
meanings.sent2: The obvolute leaves on the ground indicated autumn's arrival.
meanings.sent3: The obvolute map confused the travelers with its twists.
meanings.sent4: His obvolute excuses were hard to unravel.
meanings.sent5: The obvolute puzzle pieces fit together perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The obvolute wire was difficult to straighten.
meanings.sent2: The obvolute snake slithered through the grass.
meanings.sent3: The obvolute hair tie magically untangled itself.
meanings.sent4: His obvolute story had unexpected twists.
meanings.sent5: The obvolute path through the forest led to a hidden clearing.
